title: Provides that a vehicle shall not be towed as a result of unpaid parking fines unless such fines amount to at least five hundred dollars
summary: Provides that a vehicle shall not be towed as a result of unpaid parking fines unless such fines amount to at least five hundred dollars.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2290

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  BRENNAN,  NOLAN, MARKEY, MILLMAN, N. RIVERA,
         COLTON -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of  A.  ABBATE,  CANESTRARI,  COOK,
         GLICK, MAYERSOHN -- read once and referred to the Committee on Cities

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  administrative code of the city of New York, in
         relation to the towing of vehicles for unpaid fines

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The administrative code of the city of New York is amended
    2  by adding a new section 19-214 to read as follows:
    3    S 19-214 TOWING OF VEHICLES  FOR  UNPAID  FINES.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY
    4  OTHER  PROVISION  OF  LAW,  A  VEHICLE SHALL NOT BE TOWED AS A RESULT OF
    5  UNPAID PARKING FINES UNLESS SUCH FINES AMOUNT TO AT LEAST  FIVE  HUNDRED
    6  DOLLARS.
    7    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
    8  have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05435-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the towing of vehicles for unpaid fines
